content: जन्मन् {%<ab>n.</ab>%} [जन् भावे मनिन्] {@--1@} Birth; तां जन्मने शैलवधूं प्रपेदे <ls>Ku. 1. 21.</ls> {@--2@} Origin, rise, production, creation; आकरे पद्मरागाणां जन्म काचमणेः कुतः <ls>H. Pr. 44</ls>; <ls>Ku. 5. 60</ls>; (at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>) arising or born from; सरलस्कंधसंघदृजन्मा दवाग्निः <ls>Me. 53.</ls> {@--3@} Life, existence; पूर्वेष्वपि हि जन्मसु <ls>Ms. 9. 100</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">5. 38</ls>; <ls>Bg. 4. 5.</ls> {@--4@} Birth-place. {@--5@} Nativity. {@--6@} A father, giver of birth, progenitor; <ls>Ś. 7. 18.</ls> {@--7@} Natal star. {@--8@} (In <ab>astr.</ab>) <ab>N.</ab> of the first mansion or Nakṣatra. {@--9@} A creature, being. {@--10@} People. {@--11@} The people of a household. {@--12@} Kind, race. {@--13@} Nature; property, quality. {@--14@} Custom, manner.
